Posts.Content: One of the nurses made a great suggestion when I was trying to help my 7 yr old daughter understand., buy a special notebook & pen and she would then write little questions and place them under my pillow, then I would write a simple answer to her. (She says she didn't like to ask me to my face as she was embarrassed because it's boobys :) )
Posts.Title: Books to help children understand

Posts.Content: Hi Vanessa, I had mine about 10 days prior to yours don't worry about still needing pain killers., I still do every now and again.everyone's pain threshold different to remember. I'm sure it's a lot of hard work looking after 3 small kids normally, let alone after you're recovering from major surgery. I get exhausted just walking into town and then ache all over. You've got to remember, as someone advised me, it's only 6 weeks ago since your surgery! , give yourself time. X
Posts.Title: Recovery expectations from mastectomy with immediate reconstruction...

Posts.Content: Hi, I've just returned home after an ld flap reconstruction on my left breast. I haven't put av bra back on yet...but too soon but have an old maternity bra which has lots of extra room under arm area so am hoping that will help me as its very soft material. Maybe you could try one? Hope your recovery goes well xx
Posts.Title: DIEP surgery

Posts.Content: Hehe,!! I must have a "fat"back (can't all be muscle :) ) an only a B cup too..Can remember the surgeon really grabbing an pulling my muscle to give me an idea (ouch) I wonder if they will Lipo fill me up to a D cup if I ask nicely ;) would love a flat stomach
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, I had the ld flap reconstruction using only my own tissue. Personally didn't like the idea of implants. My surgeon was confident I had enough muscle and tissue.(I'm a 36b "ish") that was on 25th Nov.She also said if I needed to uplift the other that could be done using lipofilling at a later date. Like you I to didn't need any further treatment. It's still a big decision to make so don't worry about asking them as many questions as you need to. X
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: "Under the Red Dress". Yes she's amazing!
Posts.Title: An inspiration to us all!

Posts.Content: Oh Kay I totally understand how you feel and agree with you about feeling a bit of a fraud..but we're not. I had high grade dcis in left breast. No lump..just a discharge. I had mastectomy with immediate reconstruction and no further treatment. It's sound awful but I do sometimes wish I'd never noticed it. Then I slap myself into reality after remembering it could be so so much worse. Jacky, regards your friends on Facebook...that's so similar to mine. I asked my best friend specifically NOT to broadcast on fb due to family overseas..needless to say I am minus a friend!!! X
Posts.Title: Feel like a fraud on this site

Posts.Content: If they are still operating my brother used a good company called Medicover Travel Insurance UK. It's a while ago but they specialize in pre existing conditions. At that time that cover want that much more than standard prices.
Posts.Title: Travel Insurance - any advice

Posts.Content: My sister in law saying oh but at least you get a fabulous new Boob job for free. Grrrr. She soon changed her tune when I described in all gory detail exactly what reconstruction surgery entailed!
Posts.Title: Most outrageous, ridiculous etc

Posts.Content: Hi my bc nurse & the consultant were pretty strict with me as I had an allergic reaction to the waterproof dressings.had mine changed every week and allowed to shower fully only after almost 3 weeks.I was worried about getting an infection so was pretty cautious though. A shower is probably safer option for now. Then when you know it's ok for sure enjoy a mega long soak in the bath..I know I did x
Posts.Title: post op mastectomy dressing

Posts.Content: Hi both thankyou for your replies. That was a great help George. Very good advice about getting something in writing, especially as it turns out they forgot to give me some paperwork outlining ask my diagnosis and surgeries undergone?? Who knows why.called it a "passport" Either way was a good check up and now wearing comfy bra n having long soaks in the bath. Happy Days! :) I came out feeling more happier this time than when I was given by good news (wierd) Cheers once again xx
Posts.Title: 6week check up tomorrow after ld reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi, I have my check up in the morning. You know what it's like when your mind goes blank!!!! Has anyone got any advice on what questions I should be asking please. I was told no further treatment required ie no chemotherapy or radiotherapy. But just worried I guess. Thanks X
Posts.Title: 6week check up tomorrow after ld reconstruction
